info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 21 at 2:02PM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
info.description:
At 202 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing funnel clouds over Arabi, or over Chalmette, moving north at 10 mph.
HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...If a funnel cloud briefly touches down, minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Woodmere, Terrytown, Chalmette, Marrero, Gretna, Lakefront Airport, Harvey, New Orleans, East New Orleans, Estelle, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Arabi, Meraux, Jefferson, and Metairie.
This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 230 and 250. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors or to safe harbor and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

parameter.value: A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL ST. BERNARD, WESTERN ORLEANS, NORTH CENTRAL JEFFERSON AND NORTHWESTERN PLAQUEMINES PARISHES THROUGH 230 PM CDT

area.areaDesc: Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans; Eastern Orleans; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Central Plaquemines
